contents:
Per Curiam,
A careful consideration of the record in this case, with special reference to the assignments of error, has led us to the con elusion that the findings of fact of which the decree is predicated are substantially correct, and that the decree itself is sufficient in both form and substance. There is nothing in any of the specifications of error that requires discussion. Neither of them is sustained.
Decree affirmed and appeal dismissed with costs to be paid by the appellants.
